intro: Sinosenecio phalacrocarpus, commonly known as the black-stemmed sinosenecio, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and has slender, dark green stems with hairy surfaces. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
